[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Memory leak] Does encode_key() properly deallocate the Vec<u8> if write operations fail, or can repeated failures cause memory leaks that eventually crash the validator? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Stack overflow] Can deeply nested calls to decode_key() during recursive event iteration cause stack overflow, especially when processing long event chains? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Heap exhaustion] Can encoding extremely large ContractEvent objects (e.g., with massive event_data arrays) exhaust heap memory, causing OOM kills during block execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [CPU exhaustion] Can maliciously crafted BCS data with complex type tag structures cause decode_value() to consume excessive CPU during deserialization, enabling DoS attacks on event queries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Hash collision] Can attackers generate two different (Version, Index) pairs that hash to the same RocksDB internal key, causing event collision and data loss? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Tampering detection] Does EventSchema provide any mechanism to detect if stored events have been tampered with directly in the database, or can attackers modify event_data without detection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Signature bypass] If ContractEvent objects contain cryptographic signatures, can encode_value() preserve signature validity, or can encoding artifacts invalidate signatures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Function: encode_seek_key()] [API query manipulation] Can attackers craft Version values in API requests that cause encode_seek_key() to seek to arbitrary database positions, enabling unauthorized access to events from other accounts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Pagination attack] When paginating through events using Version-based seeks, can attackers exploit seek key boundaries to skip over pages of events, causing incomplete API responses? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Range query DoS] Can attackers request event ranges spanning billions of Version values, causing the database to scan excessive keys and exhaust I/O bandwidth? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Accumulator mismatch] If events stored in EventSchema are not reflected in the event accumulator Merkle tree, can validators accept blocks with invalid event proofs that reference non-existent events? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Proof verification bypass] Can attackers query events directly from EventSchema without providing Merkle proofs, bypassing cryptographic verification and accessing unverified event data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Event ordering in proofs] Does the (Version, Index) ordering in EventSchema match the ordering expected by Merkle proof verification, or can ordering mismatches cause proof validation failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Backup poisoning] Can an attacker inject malicious events into a database backup that pass decode_key() and decode_value() validation but corrupt validator state after restoration? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Restore version mismatch] If EventSchema format changes between backup and restore (e.g., adding new fields), can decode operations fail catastrophically, preventing validators from restoring state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Incremental backup corruption] During incremental backups, can partial event data (e.g., keys without values) be backed up, causing restore operations to fail or produce incomplete event logs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Governance event censorship] Can attackers selectively delete or corrupt governance proposal events stored in EventSchema, preventing validators from processing protocol upgrades? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Epoch transition event loss] If NewEpochEvent events are corrupted or lost from EventSchema, can validators fail to transition epochs correctly, causing network halt? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Staking event manipulation] Can attackers modify reward distribution events in EventSchema to redirect staking rewards to unauthorized accounts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [TypeTag validation] Does decode_value() validate that ContractEvent TypeTag fields reference valid Move types, or can attackers inject events with malformed type tags that crash the VM during event processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Resource type preservation] When encoding events containing Move resources, does encode_value() preserve resource semantics, or can encoding break resource uniqueness guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Event key validation] For ContractEventV1, does EventSchema validate that EventKey fields reference valid event handles, or can attackers create events with fake keys that bypass access control? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Zero values] Can (Version=0, Index=0) be encoded and stored correctly, or does this edge case cause validation failures or key collisions with genesis events? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Maximum values] Can (Version=u64::MAX, Index=u64::MAX) be decoded correctly without integer overflow, or does this edge case cause crashes during range queries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/event/mod.rs] [Schema: EventSchema] [Empty events] Can transactions emit zero events, and if so, is this case handled correctly without creating placeholder entries in EventSchema? (Low)
